SEARCH
Package acsse.csc2a.nova.models

Class CelestialBody

java.lang.Object
acsse.csc2a.nova.models.CelestialBody
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUpdateable, acsse.csc2a.nova.pattern.AbstractVisitable
public abstract class CelestialBody extends Object implements IUpdateable, acsse.csc2a.nova.pattern.AbstractVisitable
Represents a celestial body within a solar system.

Each celestial body has a name, a colour, and a radius. Optionally, it can have a parent celestial body. The name provided may include square brackets, which are removed during construction.

Version:
P04
Author:
Mr. Orfao

  • Constructor Details

    • CelestialBody

      public CelestialBody(String name, int radius, EColour colour, CelestialBody parent)
      Constructs a CelestialBody with the specified name, radius, colour, and parent.

      If the provided name contains square brackets, they are removed before storing.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the celestial body (may include square brackets which are removed)
      radius - the radius of the celestial body
      colour - the colour of the celestial body
      parent - the parent celestial body; may be null if none exists

    • CelestialBody

      public CelestialBody(String name, int radius, EColour colour)
      Constructs a CelestialBody with the specified name, radius, and colour.

      This constructor assumes that the celestial body has no parent.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the celestial body (may include square brackets which are removed)
      radius - the radius of the celestial body
      colour - the colour of the celestial body

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representation of the celestial body.

      The string contains the name, colour, and radius of the celestial body, separated by TAB characters.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a TAB-separated string representation of the celestial body
